# SCNFilterMode

**Enumeration**

Texture filtering modes, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/minificationFilter], [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/magnificationFilter], and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/mipFilter] properties.

## Declaration

```swift
enum SCNFilterMode
```

## Overview

Texture filtering determines the appearance of a material property’s contents when portions of the material surface appear larger or smaller than the original texture image. For example, when a texture is applied to a plane that recedes away from the camera into the distance:

- The texture coordinates at a point near the camera may correspond to a small fraction of a pixel in the original image. SceneKit uses the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/magnificationFilter] property to determine the color of the sampled texel at that point.
- The texture coordinates at a point far from the camera may correspond to an area of several pixels in the original image. SceneKit uses the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/minificationFilter] property to determine the color of the sampled texel at that point.

SceneKit also uses the filter specified by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/mipFilter] property when generating mipmap levels for a texture image.

## Constants

- **SCNFilterMode.none**: No texture filtering is applied.
- **SCNFilterMode.nearest**: Texture filtering returns the color from only one texel, whose location is nearest to the coordinates being sampled.
- **SCNFilterMode.linear**: Texture filtering sample texels from the neighborhood of the coordinates being sampled and linearly interpolates their colors.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Configuring Texture Mapping Attributes

- **contentsTransform**: The transformation applied to the material property’s visual contents. Animatable.
- **wrapS**: The wrapping behavior for the S texture coordinate.
- **wrapT**: The wrapping behavior for the T texture coordinate.
- **SCNWrapMode**: Modes to apply to texture wrapping, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/wrapT] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterialProperty/wrapS] properties.
- **minificationFilter**: Texture filtering for rendering the material property’s image contents at a size smaller than that of the original image.
- **magnificationFilter**: Texture filtering for rendering the material property’s image contents at a size larger than that of the original image.
- **mipFilter**: Texture filtering for using mipmaps to render the material property’s image contents at a size smaller than that of the original image.
- **maxAnisotropy**: The amount of anisotropic texture filtering to be used when rendering the material property’s image contents.
- **mappingChannel**: The source of texture coordinates for mapping the material property’s image contents.
- **borderColor**: A color used to fill in areas of a material’s surface not covered by the material property’s image contents.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
